steps.Step 1: Download the JSON file from the animation you want on Animatly.io.
steps.Step 2: Open your WordPress admin panel and edit your page with the Elementor Editor.
steps.Step 3: If you are a PRO Subscriber of Elementor, you can simply add a new element to your site. You just need to search for ‘’Lottie’’ and drag the element to the place you want.
steps.Step 3.1: If you're a free user of Elementor, you can download the Animentor plugin. To do that just go to your Plugins, click on the install button and search for the‘’ Animentor – Lottie & Bodymovin widget for Elementor’’ and install and activate it. Go to the Elementor editor and search for ‘’Lottie’’ now you should see a locked and an unlocked one. Drag the unlocked one to your page and upload the JSON file.
steps.Step 4: After that, you can upload the JSON file and take control of it.
steps.Step 5: Click on ‘’loop’’ to play the animation continuously.

title: How can I edit the source file in After Effects?
subTitle: Edit the source file

steps.Step 1: Download the After Effects file from the animation you want on Animatly.io.
steps.Step 2: Open the After Effects file with the latest version of After Effects. To prevent any issues, make sure your After Effects language is set to English.
steps.Step 3: Click on the little arrow on the layer called 'Color Controls' or 'slider and color control' then click on effects.
steps.Step 4: For a better experience we recommend opening all colors at once for illustrations. You can do that by clicking on a color and press 'CTRL' and 'A' on Windows or 'CMD' and 'A' on Mac, then click on the arrow of a color. Now All colors should be shown to you.
steps.Step 5: To edit the stroke size, click on the little arrow on 'Slider Control' 'and change the value as you like.
steps.Step 6: To have full control over the animation you must click on the 'hide layers' icon over your timeline. Once clicked you can see all layers and keyframes of the animation.

title: How can I use it for a presentation?
subTitle: Implement it in Figma or Sketch, Adobe XD, Mailchimp, Canva, and more
Best workflow for designers

body.title: Implement it in Keynote, PowerPoint, and more

steps.Step 1: Search on Animatly.io for a suitable icon or illustration for your presentation.
steps.Step 2: Open the editor by clicking on 'Edit Icon' and choose the appropriate color for your selected icon. When done, click on the 'GIF' download button.
steps.Step 3: Now you can choose the background color and the icon size. In our case the size 250x250px is sufficient.
steps.Step 4: The icon has been downloaded. Let’s drag and drop it into our presentation.
steps.Step 5: If you are using Keynote you must uncheck 'Start movie on click' so that the icon will be played from the beginning.
steps.Step 6: To see the animation you need to play (present) the presentation.

title: How can I implement it in my Design tool?
subTitle: Implement it in Figma or Sketch, Adobe XD, Mailchimp, Canva, and more

body.title: Implement it in Figma or Sketch, Adobe XD, Mailchimp, Canva, and more

steps.Step 1: Search for an illustration or icon on Animatly.io.
steps.Step 2: Click on the ‘’GIF’’ button and convert the animation to a GIF in your wished size.
steps.Step 3: Use it like you would use a normal picture in your design tool and watch the animation when previewing it.
